00039 //Current minor map version updater.
00040 #define MINOR_MAP_VERSION           25
00041 UINT8 gubMinorMapVersion = MINOR_MAP_VERSION;
00042 
00043 /*
00044 MINOR_MAP_VERSION Log -- Created by Kris Morness, November 14, 1997
00045 Version 0 -- Kris -- obsolete November 14, 1997
00046       The newly created soldier information had a couple bugs regarding initialization
00047   Bug 1)    Soldier placements without detailed slots weren't initialized.
00048       Bug 2)  The attitude variable was accidentally being generated like attributes
00049                   which usually put it completely out of range.
00050 Version 1 -- Kris -- obsolete January 7, 1998
00051       Bug 3)  New changes to the wall decals, made the currently existing ones in the world
00052                   unpredictable, and are automatically removed, so new ones can be used.
00053 Version 2 -- Kris -- obsolete February 3, 1998
00054   Bug 4)  Enemy mercs now have a color code assignment which defaults to army.
00055 Version 3 -- Kris -- obsolete February 9, 1998
00056   Bug 5)  Move entry points down if they are too high.
00057 Version 4 -- Kris -- obsolete February 25, 1998
00058   Bug 6)  Change all doors to FIRSTDOOR
00059 Version 5 -- Kris -- obsolete March 4, 1998
00060   Bug 7)  Remove all exit grids (the format has changed)
00061 Version 6 -- Kris -- obsolete March 9, 1998
00062   Bug 8)  Change droppable status of merc items so that they are all undroppable.
00063 Version 7 -- Kris -- obsolete April 14, 1998
00064       Bug 9)  Priority placements have been dropped in favor of splitting it into two categories.
00065                               The first is Detailed placements, and the second is priority existance.  So, all
00066                               current detailed placements will also have priority existance.
00067 Version 8 -- Kris -- obsolete April 16, 1998
00068       MAJOR CONFLICT RESULTING IN A MAJOR VERSION UPDATE 2.00!  
00069       Bug 10) Padding on detailed placements is uninitialized.  Clear all data starting at
00070                               fKillSlotIfOwnerDies.
00071 Version 9 -- Kris -- obsolete April 26, 1998
00072       This version requires no auto updating, but external code has adjusted the size of the mapedgepoint
00073       arraysize from UINT8 to UINT16.  See Map Edgepoints.c.
00074       Bug 11) Convert all wheelchaired placement bodytypes to cows.  Result of change in the animation database.
00075 Version 11 -- Kris -- obsolete May 2, 1998
00076   Added new center entry point.  Need to initialize the original padding to -1.
00077 */
00078 
00079 //EntryPoints can't be placed on the top two gridnos in a map.  So all we do in this case
00080 //is return the closest gridno.  Returns TRUE if the mapindex changes.
00081 BOOLEAN ValidateEntryPointGridNo( INT16 *sGridNo )
00082 {
00083       INT16 sXMapPos, sYMapPos;
00084       INT16 sWorldX, sWorldY;
00085       INT32 iNewMapX, iNewMapY;
00086       INT16 sTopLimit, sBottomLimit;
00087 
00088       if( *sGridNo < 0 )
00089             return FALSE; //entry point is non-existant
00090 
00091       ConvertGridNoToXY( *sGridNo, &sXMapPos, &sYMapPos );
00092 
00093       sTopLimit = 80;
00094       sBottomLimit = gsBRY - gsTLY - 40;
00095 
00096       //Get screen coordinates for current gridno
00097       GetWorldXYAbsoluteScreenXY( sXMapPos, sYMapPos, &sWorldX, &sWorldY);
00098 
00099       if( sWorldY < sTopLimit )
00100       {
00101             GetFromAbsoluteScreenXYWorldXY( &iNewMapX, &iNewMapY, sWorldX, sTopLimit );
00102       }
00103       else if( sWorldY > sBottomLimit )
00104       {
00105             GetFromAbsoluteScreenXYWorldXY( &iNewMapX, &iNewMapY, sWorldX, sBottomLimit );
00106       }
00107       else
00108       {
00109             return FALSE; //already valid
00110       }
00111 
00112       *sGridNo = (INT16)MAPROWCOLTOPOS( iNewMapY/10, iNewMapX/10 );
00113 
00114       return TRUE; //modified
00115 }

00117 void SaveMapInformation( HWFILE fp )
00118 {
00119       UINT32 uiBytesWritten;
00120 
00121       gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = MINOR_MAP_VERSION;
00122       FileWrite( fp, &gMapInformation, sizeof( MAPCREATE_STRUCT ), &uiBytesWritten );
00123 }

00125 void LoadMapInformation( INT8 **hBuffer )
00126 {
00127       LOADDATA( &gMapInformation, *hBuffer, sizeof( MAPCREATE_STRUCT ) );
00128       //FileRead( hfile, &gMapInformation, sizeof( MAPCREATE_STRUCT ), &uiBytesRead);
00129 
00130       // ATE: OK, do some handling here for basement level scroll restrictions
00131       // Calcuate world scrolling restrictions
00132       InitRenderParams( gMapInformation.ubRestrictedScrollID );
00133 }

00135 //This will automatically update obsolete map versions to the new ones.  This will even
00136 //work in the game itself, but would require conversion to happen every time.  This is completely 
00137 //transparent to the rest of the game, but in the editor, obsolete versions will be updated upon 
00138 //loading and won't be permanently updated until the map is saved, regardless of changes.
00139 void UpdateOldVersionMap()
00140 {
00141 #if 0 //This code is no longer needed since the major version update from 1.0 to 4.0
00142                   //However, I am keeping it in for reference.
00143       SOLDIERINITNODE *curr;
00144       INT32 i;
00145       LEVELNODE *pStruct;
00146       //VERSION 0 -- obsolete November 14, 1997
00147       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 0 )
00148       {
00149             //Soldier information contained two fixable bugs.
00150             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00151             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00152             while( curr )
00153             {
00154                   //Bug #01)  Nodes without detailed slots weren't initialized.
00155                   if( !curr->pBasicPlacement->fDetailedPlacement )
00156                         curr->pDetailedPlacement = NULL;
00157                   //Bug #02)  The attitude variable was accidentally being generated like attributes
00158                   //                            which put it completely out of range.
00159                   if( curr->pBasicPlacement->bAttitude > 7 )
00160                         curr->pBasicPlacement->bAttitude = (INT8)Random(8);
00161                   //go to next node
00162                   curr = curr->next;
00163             }
00164       }
00165       //VERSION 1 -- obsolete January 7, 1998
00166       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 1 )
00167       {     
00168             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00169             //Bug #03)  Removing all wall decals from map, because of new changes to the slots
00170             //                            as well as certain decals found commonly in illegal places.
00171             for( i = 0; i < WORLD_MAX; i++ )
00172             {
00173                   RemoveAllStructsOfTypeRange( i, FIRSTWALLDECAL, LASTWALLDECAL );
00174                   RemoveAllStructsOfTypeRange( i, FIFTHWALLDECAL, SIXTHWALLDECAL );
00175             }
00176       }
00177       //VERSION 2 -- obsolete February 3, 1998
00178       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 2 )
00179       {
00180             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00181             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00182             while( curr )
00183             {
00184                   //Bug #04)  Assign enemy mercs default army color code if applicable
00185                   if( curr->pBasicPlacement->bTeam == ENEMY_TEAM && !curr->pBasicPlacement->ubSoldierClass )
00186                   {
00187                         if( !curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00188                         {
00189                               curr->pBasicPlacement->ubSoldierClass = SOLDIER_CLASS_ARMY;
00190                         }
00191                         else if( curr->pDetailedPlacement && curr->pDetailedPlacement->ubProfile == NO_PROFILE )
00192                         {
00193                               curr->pBasicPlacement->ubSoldierClass = SOLDIER_CLASS_ARMY;
00194                               curr->pDetailedPlacement->ubSoldierClass = SOLDIER_CLASS_ARMY;
00195                         }
00196                   }
00197                   curr = curr->next;
00198             }
00199       }
00200       //VERSION 3 -- obsolete February 9, 1998
00201       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 3 )
00202       {
00203             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00204             //Bug #05)  Move entry points down if necessary.
00205             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sNorthGridNo );
00206             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sEastGridNo );
00207             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sSouthGridNo );
00208             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sWestGridNo );
00209       }
00210       //VERSION 4 -- obsolete February 25, 1998
00211       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 4 )
00212       {
00213             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00214             //6)  Change all doors to FIRSTDOOR
00215             for( i = 0; i < WORLD_MAX; i++ )
00216             {
00217                   //NOTE:  Here are the index values for the various doors
00218                   //DOOR            OPEN        CLOSED
00219                   //FIRST            916               912
00220                   //SECOND     936       932
00221                   //THIRD            956       952
00222                   //FOURTH     976       972
00223                   pStruct = gpWorldLevelData[ i ].pStructHead;
00224                   while( pStruct )
00225                   {
00226                         //outside topleft
00227                         if( pStruct->usIndex == 932 || pStruct->usIndex == 952 || pStruct->usIndex == 972 )
00228                         {
00229                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 912 );
00230                               break;
00231                         }
00232                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 936 || pStruct->usIndex == 956 || pStruct->usIndex == 976 )
00233                         {     
00234                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 916 );
00235                               break;
00236                         }
00237                         //outside topright
00238                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 927 || pStruct->usIndex == 947 || pStruct->usIndex == 967 )
00239                         {
00240                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 907 );
00241                               break;
00242                         }
00243                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 931 || pStruct->usIndex == 951 || pStruct->usIndex == 971 )
00244                         {
00245                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 911 );
00246                               break;
00247                         }
00248                         //inside topleft
00249                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 942 || pStruct->usIndex == 962 || pStruct->usIndex == 982 )
00250                         {
00251                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 922 );
00252                               break;
00253                         }
00254                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 946 || pStruct->usIndex == 966 || pStruct->usIndex == 986 )
00255                         {
00256                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 926 );
00257                               break;
00258                         }
00259                         //inside topright
00260                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 937 || pStruct->usIndex == 957 || pStruct->usIndex == 977 )
00261                         {
00262                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 917 );
00263                               break;
00264                         }
00265                         else if( pStruct->usIndex == 941 || pStruct->usIndex == 961 || pStruct->usIndex == 981 )
00266                         {
00267                               ReplaceStructIndex( i, pStruct->usIndex, 921 );
00268                               break;
00269                         }
00270                         pStruct = pStruct->pNext;
00271                   }
00272             }
00273       }
00274       //VERSION 5 -- obsolete March 4, 1998
00275       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 5 )
00276       {
00277             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00278         //Bug 7)  Remove all exit grids (the format has changed)
00279             for( i = 0; i < WORLD_MAX; i++ )
00280                   RemoveExitGridFromWorld( i );
00281       }
00282       //VERSION 6 -- obsolete March 9, 1998
00283       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 6 )
00284       { //Bug 8)  Change droppable status of merc items so that they are all undroppable.
00285             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00286             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00287             while( curr )
00288             {
00289                   //Bug #04)  Assign enemy mercs default army color code if applicable
00290                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00291                   {
00292                         for( i = 0; i < NUM_INV_SLOTS; i++ )
00293                         { //make all items undroppable, even if it is empty.  This will allow for 
00294                               //random item generation, while empty, droppable slots are locked as empty
00295                               //during random item generation.
00296                               curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ].fFlags |= OBJECT_UNDROPPABLE;
00297                         }
00298                   }
00299                   curr = curr->next;
00300             }
00301       }
00302       //VERSION 7 -- obsolete April 14, 1998
00303       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 7 )
00304       {
00305             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00306             //Bug 9)  Priority placements have been dropped in favor of splitting it into two categories.
00307             //                      The first is Detailed placements, and the second is priority existance.  So, all
00308             //                      current detailed placements will also have priority existance.
00309             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00310             while( curr )
00311             {
00312                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00313                   {
00314                         curr->pBasicPlacement->fPriorityExistance = TRUE;
00315                   }
00316                   curr = curr->next;
00317             }
00318       }
00319 
00320       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 14 )
00321       { //Toast all of the ambiguous road pieces that ended up wrapping the byte.
00322             LEVELNODE *pStruct, *pStruct2;
00323             INT32 i;
00324             for( i = 0; i < WORLD_MAX; i++ )
00325             {
00326                   pStruct = gpWorldLevelData[ i ].pObjectHead;
00327                   if( pStruct && pStruct->usIndex == 1078 && i < WORLD_MAX-2 && i >= 320 )
00328                   { //This is the only detectable road piece that we can repair.
00329                         pStruct2 = gpWorldLevelData[ i+1 ].pObjectHead;
00330                         if( pStruct2 && pStruct2->usIndex == 1081 )
00331                         {
00332                               RemoveObject( i, pStruct->usIndex );
00333                               RemoveObject( i+1, pStruct->usIndex+1 );
00334                               RemoveObject( i+2, pStruct->usIndex+2 );
00335                               RemoveObject( i-160, pStruct->usIndex-160 );
00336                               RemoveObject( i-159, pStruct->usIndex-159 );
00337                               RemoveObject( i-158, pStruct->usIndex-158 );
00338                               RemoveObject( i-320, pStruct->usIndex-320 );
00339                               RemoveObject( i-319, pStruct->usIndex-319 );
00340                               RemoveObject( i-318, pStruct->usIndex-318 );
00341                               AddObjectToTail( i, 1334 );
00342                               AddObjectToTail( i-160, 1335 );
00343                               AddObjectToTail( i-320, 1336 );
00344                               AddObjectToTail( i+1, 1337 );
00345                               AddObjectToTail( i-159, 1338 );
00346                               AddObjectToTail( i-319, 1339 );
00347                               AddObjectToTail( i+2, 1340 );
00348                               AddObjectToTail( i-158, 1341 );
00349                               AddObjectToTail( i-318, 1342 );
00350                         }
00351                   }
00352                   else if( pStruct && pStruct->usIndex >= 1079 && pStruct->usIndex < 1115 )
00353                   {
00354                         RemoveObject( i, pStruct->usIndex );
00355                   }
00356             }           
00357       }
00358 
00359       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion <= 7 )
00360       {
00361             if( gfEditMode )
00362             {
00363                   #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00364                         ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_RED, MSG_ERROR, L"Currently loaded map is corrupt!  Allowing the map to load anyway!" );
00365                   #endif
00366             }
00367             else
00368             {
00369                   if( gbWorldSectorZ )
00370                   {
00371                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Currently loaded map (%c%d_b%d.dat) is invalid -- less than the minimum supported version.", gWorldSectorY + 'A' - 1, gWorldSectorX, gbWorldSectorZ ) );
00372                   }
00373                   else if( !gbWorldSectorZ )
00374                   {
00375                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Currently loaded map (%c%d.dat) is invalid -- less than the minimum supported version.", gWorldSectorY + 'A' - 1, gWorldSectorX ) );
00376                   }
00377             }
00378       }
00379       //VERSION 8 -- obsolete April 18, 1998
00380       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 8 )
00381       {
00382             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00383             //Bug 10) Padding on detailed placements is uninitialized.  Clear all data starting at
00384             //                      fKillSlotIfOwnerDies.
00385             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00386             while( curr )
00387             {
00388                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00389                   {
00390                         //The size 120 was hand calculated.  The remaining padding was 118 bytes
00391                         //and there were two one byte fields cleared, fKillSlotIfOwnerDies and ubScheduleID
00392                         memset( &curr->pDetailedPlacement->fKillSlotIfOwnerDies, 0, 120 );
00393                   }
00394                   curr = curr->next;
00395             }
00396       }
00397       //Version 9 -- Kris -- obsolete April 27, 1998
00398       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion == 9 )
00399       {
00400             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00401             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00402             while( curr )
00403             {
00404                   //Bug 11) Convert all wheelchaired placement bodytypes to cows.  Result of change in the animation database.
00405                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement && curr->pDetailedPlacement->bBodyType == CRIPPLECIV )
00406                   {
00407                         curr->pDetailedPlacement->bBodyType = COW;
00408                         curr->pBasicPlacement->bBodyType = COW;
00409                   }
00410                   curr = curr->next;
00411             }
00412       }
00413       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 12 )
00414       {
00415             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 12;
00416             gMapInformation.sCenterGridNo = -1;
00417       }
00418       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 13 )
00419       {     //replace all merc ammo inventory slots status value with the max ammo that the clip can hold.
00420             INT32 i, cnt;
00421             OBJECTTYPE *pItem;
00422             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00423             //Bug 10) Padding on detailed placements is uninitialized.  Clear all data starting at
00424             //                      fKillSlotIfOwnerDies.
00425             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00426             while( curr )
00427             {
00428                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00429                   {
00430                         for ( i = 0; i < NUM_INV_SLOTS; i++ )
00431                         {
00432                               pItem = &curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ];
00433                               if( Item[ pItem->usItem ].usItemClass & IC_AMMO )
00434                               {
00435                                     for( cnt = 0; cnt < pItem->ubNumberOfObjects; cnt++ )
00436                                     {
00437                                           pItem->ubShotsLeft[ cnt ] = Magazine[ Item[ pItem->usItem ].ubClassIndex ].ubMagSize;
00438                                     }
00439                               }
00440                         }
00441                   }
00442                   curr = curr->next;
00443             }
00444       }
00445       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 14 )
00446       {
00447             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion++;
00448             if( !gfCaves && !gfBasement )
00449             {
00450                   ReplaceObsoleteRoads();
00451             }
00452       }
00453       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 15 )
00454       { //Do nothing.  The object layer was expanded from 1 byte to 2 bytes, effecting the
00455             //size of the maps.  This was due to the fact that the ROADPIECES tileset contains
00456             //over 300 pieces, hence requiring a size increase of the tileset subindex for this
00457             //layer only.
00458       }
00459 #endif //end of MAJOR VERSION 3.0 obsolete code
00460       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 15 )
00461       { 
00462             AssertMsg( 0, "Map is less than minimum supported version." );
00463       }
00464       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 16 )
00465       {
00466             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 16;
00467             gMapInformation.sIsolatedGridNo = -1;
00468       }
00469       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 17 )
00470       {
00471             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 17;
00472             //EliminateObjectLayerRedundancy();
00473       }
00474       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 18 )
00475       {
00476             // replace useless crowbars with proper ones
00477             UINT32 i;
00478             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 18;
00479             for ( i = 0; i < guiNumWorldItems; i++ )
00480             {
00481                   if ( gWorldItems[ i ].o.usItem == JAR_ELIXIR )
00482                   {
00483                         gWorldItems[ i ].o.usItem = CROWBAR;
00484                   }
00485             }
00486       }
00487       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 19 )
00488       {
00489             //Do nothing, this is used to force regenerate the map edgepoints in map edgepoints.c
00490             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 19;
00491       }
00492       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 20 )
00493       {
00494             //validate the map entry points as the world boundaries have changed.
00495             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 20;
00496             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sNorthGridNo );
00497             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sEastGridNo );
00498             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sSouthGridNo );
00499             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sWestGridNo );
00500             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sCenterGridNo );
00501             ValidateEntryPointGridNo( &gMapInformation.sIsolatedGridNo );
00502       }
00503       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 21 )
00504       {
00505             SOLDIERINITNODE *curr;
00506             //override any item slots being locked if there is no item in that slot.
00507             //Laymen terms:  If any items slots are locked to be empty, make them empty but available
00508             //for random item generation.
00509             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 21;
00510             curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00511             while( curr )
00512             {
00513                   if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00514                   {
00515                         INT32 i;
00516                         for( i = 0; i < NUM_INV_SLOTS; i++ )
00517                         {
00518                               if( !curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ].usItem )
00519                               {
00520                                     if( curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ].fFlags & OBJECT_UNDROPPABLE )
00521                                     {
00522                                           if( curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ].fFlags & OBJECT_NO_OVERWRITE )
00523                                           {
00524                                                 curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ].fFlags &= ~OBJECT_NO_OVERWRITE;
00525                                           }
00526                                     }
00527                               }
00528                         }
00529                   }
00530                   curr = curr->next;
00531             }
00532       }
00533       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 22 )
00534       { //Allow map edgepoints to be regenerated as new system has been reenabled.
00535             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 22;
00536       }
00537       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 23 )
00538       { //Allow map edgepoints to be regenerated as new system has been reenabled.
00539             SOLDIERINITNODE *curr;
00540             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 23;
00541             if( giCurrentTilesetID == 1 ) //cave/mine tileset only 
00542             { //convert all civilians to miners which use uniforms and more masculine body types.
00543                   curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00544                   while( curr )
00545                   {
00546                         if( curr->pBasicPlacement->bTeam == CIV_TEAM && !curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00547                         {
00548                               curr->pBasicPlacement->ubSoldierClass = SOLDIER_CLASS_MINER;
00549                               curr->pBasicPlacement->bBodyType = -1;
00550                         }
00551                         curr = curr->next;
00552                   }
00553             }
00554       }
00555       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < 25 )
00556       { 
00557             gMapInformation.ubMapVersion = 25;
00558             if( gfCaves )
00559             {
00560                   LightSetBaseLevel( 13 );
00561             }
00562       }
00563 }
00564 
00565 void AutoCalculateItemNoOverwriteStatus() 
00566 {
00567       SOLDIERINITNODE *curr;
00568       INT32 i;
00569       OBJECTTYPE *pItem;
00570 
00571       //Recalculate the "no overwrite" status flag on all items.  There are two different cases:
00572       //1)  If detailed placement has item, the item "no overwrite" flag is set
00573       //2)  If detailed placement doesn't have item, but item is set to drop (forced empty slot), the "no overwrite" flag is set.
00574       curr = gSoldierInitHead;
00575       while( curr )
00576       {
00577             if( curr->pDetailedPlacement )
00578             {
00579                   for( i = 0; i < NUM_INV_SLOTS; i++ )
00580                   {
00581                         pItem = &curr->pDetailedPlacement->Inv[ i ];
00582                         if( pItem->usItem != NONE )
00583                         {     //case 1 (see above)
00584                               pItem->fFlags |= OBJECT_NO_OVERWRITE;
00585                         }
00586                         else if( !(pItem->fFlags & OBJECT_UNDROPPABLE) )
00587                         { //case 2 (see above)
00588                               pItem->fFlags |= OBJECT_NO_OVERWRITE;
00589                         }
00590                   }
00591             }
00592             curr = curr->next;
00593       }
00594 }
00595 
00596 void ValidateAndUpdateMapVersionIfNecessary()
00597 {
00598       //Older versions of mercs may require updating due to past bug fixes, new changes, etc.
00599       if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion < MINOR_MAP_VERSION )
00600       {
00601             SetRelativeStartAndEndPercentage( 0, 92, 93, L"Updating older map version..." );
00602             RenderProgressBar( 0, 0 );
00603             UpdateOldVersionMap();
00604       }
00605       else if( gMapInformation.ubMapVersion > MINOR_MAP_VERSION )
00606       {
00607             //we may have a problem...
00608             //AssertMsg( 0, "Map version is greater than the current version (old ja2.exe?)" );
00609       }
00610       AutoCalculateItemNoOverwriteStatus() ;
00611 }
00612 
00613 #ifdef JA2EDITOR
00614 #include "Exit Grids.h"
00615 #include "Summary Info.h"
00616 //This function is used to avoid conflicts between minor version updates and sector summary info.
00617 //By updating the summary info in conjunction with minor version updates, we can avoid these conflicts
00618 //and really prevent major map updates.
00619 void UpdateSummaryInfo( SUMMARYFILE *pSummary )
00620 {
00621       if( pSummary->MapInfo.ubMapVersion == MINOR_MAP_VERSION )
00622             return;
00623       if( pSummary->MapInfo.ubMapVersion < 9 )
00624       { //See bug 10
00625             pSummary->ubCivSchedules = 0;
00626       }
00627       if( pSummary->MapInfo.ubMapVersion < 12 )
00628       {
00629             pSummary->MapInfo.sCenterGridNo = -1;
00630       }
00631       if( pSummary->MapInfo.ubMapVersion < 16 )
00632       {
00633             pSummary->MapInfo.sIsolatedGridNo = -1;
00634       }
00635 }
00636 #endif
